body_html: Why is the TracerState indirection necessary. I'm talking about code like this. How do I tell which passes return a new value and which modify the graph in place? They should at least have a name that makes them stick out.
body_text: Why is the TracerState indirection necessary. I'm talking about code like this. How do I tell which passes return a new value and which modify the graph in place? They should at least have a name that makes them stick out.
body: Why is the TracerState indirection necessary. I'm talking about [code like this](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/6598/files#diff-047710af6397e01470a650cef734c7e0L87). How do I tell which passes return a new value and which modify the graph in place? They should at least have a name that makes them stick out.
